description.plain:
Stray Kids is a K-pop group formed by JYP Entertainment through the 2017 reality show of the same name. The band has eight members: Bang Chan, Lee Know, Changbin, Hyunjin, Han, Felix, Seungmin,  I.N. They can further be separated into three units: 3RACHA (the producing/rap unit), VOCALRACHA (the vocal unit) and DANCERACHA (the dance unit).

Stray Kids' first self-produced tracks were shown during the survival show, with first single “Hellevator” getting a music video prior to the show’s premiere. The rest of the tracks were included in their January 2018 pre-debut EP titled Mixtape which debuted at #2 on Gaon Album Chart and Billboard World Albums Chart.

Stray Kids officially debuted on March 25, 2018, with their lead single “District 9” and EP I am NOT. This was followed by two more EPs in 2018, I am WHO? and I am YOU. These three EPs make up Stray Kids' first trilogy, dubbed the I am… series. They were met with widespread success in 2018, with each EP outselling the last. Stray Kids picked up eight rookie awards in the 2018 award season.

The first instalment of their second trilogy Clé was released on March 25, 2019, one year after their debut. Its' title track “MIROH” amassed a lot of public attention, earning the group their first music show win on MCountdown’s April 4 broadcast. The second installment’s title track, the psytrance “Side Effects” also gathered a lot of public attention due to its' originality. In October of that year, former member Woojin left the group, for what JYPE only revealed to be “personal reasons.” The final instalment of the series, Clé : LEVANTER found Stray Kids starting to redefine their image as they dealt with the struggles of adapting to their new group line up.

The beginning of 2020 saw many projects for Stray Kids. Their first English versions were released on Step Out of Clé and Japanese versions on SKZ2020. The latter also included past songs with re-distributed parts to fit their new line up. Additionally, their Mixtape Project consisted of two unexpected releases: “Gone Days” and “On Track” and the band recorded the opening and ending songs for the anime Kami no Tō -Tower of God-.

Stray Kids' first full album, GO生 garnered a whole new image for the group. Released in June 2020, the title track “神메뉴 (God’s Menu)” showed off the group’s individuality and desire to do something different in the music industry, and it saw them a lot of success as the album topped the Gaon Chart. The effects of this inflation of success were evident in their next release, the repackage album IN生, with the album amassing  200,000 sales in the first week and title track “Back Door” garnering two music show wins. An official Japanese debut with “All In” followed shortly after.

2021’s activities started with Stray Kids joining Mnet’s Kingdom: Legendary War, competing alongside other K-Pop boy groups, taking first place on the show overall. After the show, they continued their Mixtape Project with “애 (OH),” which topped the Billboard’s World Digital Song Sales, marking the group’s first #1.

songs.title: Levanter (English Ver.)

description.plain:
“Levanter” expresses the need to move on and accept reality away from the anticipation of a perfect state. It’s about letting go of something but with hope and possibility, and with the awareness that the path is ultimately theirs to define.

Some fans suggest that this song is about letting go of former member Woojin, who left the group in late 2019 citing unknown personal reasons.

songs.embed_content: Read “Levanter (English Ver.)” by Stray Kids on Genius

songs.lyrics:
39 ContributorsTranslationsEspañolLevanter (English Ver.) Lyrics[Verse 1: Bang Chan, Lee Know, I.N, Changbin]
Never wanted anything as much as you
Never crossed my mind that I could ever lose
I had this picture in my head
Of all the promises you've made
But you turned them into dust
Empty-handed, now I'm lost
I know I gotta let go
With no regrets, you're already gone

[Pre-Chorus: Lee Know, Han]
(Oh) I let my dreams tie me down
(Oh) Is it too late, can I break out?
(Oh) They say it's darkest of all before the dawn

[Chorus: Seungmin, Han, Bang Chan]
I wanna be myself (I don't care)
Yeah, I gotta be myself (Just don't care)
And now that your weight's come off my shoulders
I realize that I can fly
I needed to find me (Now I know)
The key was inside of me all along
I'm listening to my heart, let it guide me
I feel the light, I feel the light

[Verse 2: Felix, Hyunjin, Lee Know, Changbin]
I never stopped (To find my way)
I always thought (It was a race)
To win it all, and that you were the prize
The closer I got, the more I lost
My soul, it was slowly fading
I'm like the autumn leaves, don't know which way I'm blowing
But it don't matter if it's raining or it's snowing
All of my problems growing smaller when I'm way up here
Any illusions I had left about you disappeared
You might also like[Pre-Chorus: Seungmin, Lee Know, Han]
(Oh) This is the end of the road
(Oh) Oh, I'm holding out for a new hope
(Oh) 'Cause it's the darkest of all before the dawn

[Chorus: Seungmin, Han, Bang Chan]
I wanna be myself (I don't care)
Yeah, I gotta be myself (Just don't care)
And now that your weight's come off my shoulders
I realize that I can fly
I needed to find me (Now I know)
The key was inside of me all along
I'm listening to my heart, let it guide me
I feel the light, I feel the light

[Bridge: I.N, Felix]
Afraid to let you go
But in my heart, I know
Got to move on, I think it's time
It's all good now

[Chorus: Bang Chan, Han]
I wanna be myself (I don't care)
Yeah, I gotta be myself (Just don't care)
And now that I left it all behind me
I'm flying high, I'm flying high20Embed

songs.title: SLUMP (English Version)

description.plain:
“SLUMP” is the first official ending theme song to the anime adaptation of the popular manhwa (Korean webtoon/comic) Tower of God, called 신의 탑 in Korean, written and illustrated by SIU.

The webtoon began serialization July 5, 2010 on Naver Webtoon. The anime adaptation, titled 神之塔 -Tower of God-, a collaboration between Naver’s LINE Webtoon and Crunchyroll, officially began airing on April 2, 2020.
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETXju-EXQAAJ95g.jpg:large

songs.embed_content: Read “SLUMP (English Version)” by Stray Kids on Genius

body.plain:
“SLUMP” is the first official ending theme song to the anime adaptation of the popular manhwa (Korean webtoon/comic) Tower of God, called 신의 탑 in Korean, written and illustrated by SIU.

The webtoon began serialization July 5, 2010 on Naver Webtoon. The anime adaptation, titled 神之塔 -Tower of God-, a collaboration between Naver’s LINE Webtoon and Crunchyroll, officially began airing on April 2, 2020.
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETXju-EXQAAJ95g.jpg:large

songs.lyrics:
18 ContributorsSLUMP (English Version) Lyrics[Verse 1: Felix, Changbin]
Where you going? It's hard to keep up
You're moving so fast, leaving me behind
Give me an hour, that's all I need
It's now or never, I'm running out of time
The seconds are relentless, I'm helpless as they keep flying by
Stuck here in the desert, I feel like I'm in an hourglass
Maybe I can stay and be comfortable living in the past
But I don't wanna be alone so can you take me to you now

[Pre-Chorus: Lee Know, I.N]
Too fast, I try to follow but I'm losing hope
We used to walk together down this winding road
But you're so far ahead, it seems impossible to catch up

[Chorus: Bang Chan, Han]
And now I'm walking on my way, all alone, I'm feeling so cold
Not getting anywhere, I feel like I'm in slow mode
Used to be a winner, everything was all black and white
Now I'm bottom of the pile, a dusty photo

[Post-Chorus: Bang Chan, Seungmin]
I'm afraid I'm gonna be left stranded by myself
All the foolish dreams I had inside of me are broken
Everything I wanted in the distance out of reach
Am I the only one that's gon' stay here forgotten, ayy
You might also like[Verse 2: Hyunjin, Changbin, Han]
So many thoughts are inside of my head
I'm always drying these tears on my face
How could I ever get used to the fact that
The songs and the lyrics, they all sound the same
"Come on, I know you can do it"
I have to repeat it again and again, yeah
I wanna look in the mirror
Telling myself that I did a good job, ayy
Everyone gonna be watching
I gotta show 'em all of me
But I've been insecure lately
'Cause I don't know what they want from me, ayy
Feeling so nervous, I wanna go forward
But everyone else overtaking me
Blocking my vision, my body is shaking
I don't know if I can keep up, yeah, yeah

[Pre-Chorus: Lee Know, I.N]
Too fast, I try to follow but I'm losing hope
We used to walk together down this winding road
But you're so far ahead, it seems impossible to catch up

[Chorus: Bang Chan, Han]
And now I'm walking on my way, all alone, I'm feeling so cold
Not getting anywhere, I feel like I'm in slow mode
Used to be a winner, everything was all black and white
Now I'm bottom of the pile, a dusty photo
[Post-Chorus: Bang Chan, Seungmin]
I'm afraid I'm gonna be left stranded by myself
All the foolish dreams I had inside of me are broken
Everything I wanted in the distance out of reach
Am I the only one that's gon' stay here forgotten, ayy8Embed

songs.title: DOMINO (English Ver.)

description.plain: Domino is a song full of puns, including musical puns.  Most obviously, it includes references to pizza (like the franchise Domino’s).  Musically, we repeat a quick downward or upward glissando at several key points in the song to reference the sound that dominos make as they fall.  It was originally released partially in Korean as part of the album NOEASY, and released with minor changes entirely in English for Christmas EveL.

songs.embed_content: Read “DOMINO (English Ver.)” by Stray Kids on Genius

It was originally released partially in Korean as part of the album NOEASY, and released with minor changes entirely in English for Christmas EveL.

Do-re-mi-fa-sol-la-ti-do
Rise to the highest, baby, look at my scale (Ha)
Mmm, nothing is challenging
When I take a shot, yeah, I ain't gonna fail (Ha)
Mmm, I’ma eat the whole box
Every topping that you can imagine
(Daeng, daeng, daeng, pizza) Mmm?
Franchise overpowered
Got their eyes on me
Hate or love, see they gon' imitate
Can't stop following
Prolly cause we always dominate
Yeah, I know, yeah, I know
Yeah, they want a piece of mine
Better not hesitate
When it all comes crashing on your face

[Pre-Chorus: Bang Chan, Seungmin, I.N, Lee Know]
Setting up my ambitions
Check ’em one at a time, yeah, I made it
Now it's time for ignition
I'm the start, heat it up
They follow, burning up a chain reaction, oh, oh, oh
Go fire it up, oh, oh, no
Assemble the crowd now, now
Line 'em up on the ground
No leaving anyone behind
You might also like[Chorus: Hyunjin, All, Changbin, Felix]

I'ma knock it down like domino
Domino, domino, domino, domino, domino, domino
Dan-dan-dan-dan

Play (Play)
With a little motion, get everyone's attention
Pay attention
I don't play (Play)
I ain’t messin’ 'round when I start a new sensation, yeah
Like domino

Ayy, domino, flick and a drop and I see it all fall down
Shakin’ the world, magnitude makin' everything crumble like blah, blah
Okay, all that's left is dust, A.K.A. "The Bulldozer"
Right when everyone falls, they're crawling ’cause they can't help but follow
Spitting out a single joke makes everybody L-O-L
Think you can outdo me? Let me kick you out to somewhere else (Bye-bye)
I always try to do it one by one
But I know with just a single nod, I'm knocking over millions

Just a little nudge, they think they won't budge
In the end, they all come falling down, they're not like us
The jealousy inside, there's envy in their eyes

Hey, there ain't no stoppin' the domino
